explanation: There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
I. Its velocity is constant
II. No work is done on the body
III. It has constant acceleration directed away from the centre
IV. The centripetal force is directed towards the centre

Which combination of the above is true of a body moving with constant speed in a circular track?
explanation:
The acceleration is not constant, i.e. its direction changes although the magnitude is constant (III is wrong), another thing that makes III wrong is the fact that the acceleration is not directed away from the centre but towards the centre.- No work is done on a body undergoing circular motion- Note that when a body is undergoing circular motion ], its velocity is not constant, i.e. the direction changes, although the magnitude is constant.- Since the acceleration is directed towards the centre, the centripetal force is directed towards the centre.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The velocity ratio of a machine is 5 and its efficiency is 75%. What effort would be needed to lift a load of 150N with the machine?
explanation:
Efficiency = \(\frac{\text{M.A}}{\text{V.R}}\)75% = \(\frac{\text{M.A}}{\text{V.R}}\)\(\frac{75}{100} = \frac{\text{M.A}}{5}\)M.A = \(\frac{75(5)}{100}\) = 3.75But M.A = \(\frac{\text{Load}}{\text{Effort}}\)3.75 = \(\frac{150}{\text{Effort}}\)Effort = \(\frac{150}{3.75}\)Effort = 40N
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: At a fixed point below a liquid surface, the pressure downwards is P1 and pressure upwards is P2. It can be deduced that?
explanation:
As the temperature increases, the molecules in the gas move faster, impacting the gas's container more frequently and exerting a greater force. This increases the pressure. And similarly As the pressure goes up, the temperature also goes up. So the temperature and the pressure is directly proportional to each other. At a fixed point, temperature is kept constant. Hence, at this point, it can be deduced that \(P_{1} = P_{2}\)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: If the force and the velocity on a system are each reduced simultaneously by half, the power of the system is
explanation:
TheRelation between Power,ForceandVelocityis given by the relation:
P = F.V , thispoweris the product offorceandvelocity.
Therefore, The power of the system is reduced toone-quarterof its original value when both the force and the velocity are reduced by half.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: A catapult used to hold a stone of mass 500g is extended by 20cm with an applied force F. If the stone leaves with a velocity of 40m/s, the value of F is
explanation:
Given: mass of stone = 500g = 0.5kg, e = 20cm = 0.2m, velocity of stone on leaving the catapult = 40m/s
The potential energy stored in the catapult when extended = the kinetic energy (KE) of the stone
\(\frac{1}{2}\)Fe = \(\frac{1}{2}\)mv\(^2\)
F x 0.2 = 0.5 x 40 x 40
F = \(\frac{800}{0.2}\) = 4000 N = 4 x 10\(^3\) N

text: A stream is flowing at 0.75ms\(^{-1}\) and a boat heading perpendicular for the stream landed at the opposite bank at an angle of 30°. Calculate the velocity of the boat.
explanation:
Let the velocity of stream be Vs = 0.75m/s
Angle at which the boat lands θ = 30º
the velocity of the boat = Vb
\(\frac{0.75}{V_b}\) = Sin30º = 0.5
∴ V\(_b\) = \(\frac{0.75}{0.5}\) = 1.5m/s
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: A rope is being used to pull a mass of 10kg vertically upward. Determine the tension in the rope if, starting from rest, the mass acquires a velocity of 4ms\(^{-1}\) in 8s [g = 10ms\(^{-2}\)]
explanation:
Tension = Force of gravity + acceleration force
= mg + ma
\(a = \frac{v - u}{t}\)
= \(\frac{4 - 0}{8}\)
= 0.5 ms\(^{-2}\)
Tension = (\(10 \times 10) + 10 \times 0.5\)
= 100 + 5
= 105N
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
I. The frictional force is independent of the area of the surfaces in conduct
II. The frictional force depends on the nature of the surfaces in contact
III. The frictional force depends on the speed of sliding
IV. The frictional force is directly proportional to the normal reaction.

Which combination of the above is true of sliding friction?
explanation:
LAWS OF SOLID FRICTION: Friction opposes the relative motion of two surfaces in contact. It is independent of the area of the surface of contact. It depends on the nature of the surface. It is proportional to normal reaction (R). It is independent of the relative velocity between the surfaces.
Therefore, the true statements regarding sliding friction areI, II, and IV.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Total internal reflection occurs when light moves from?

options.A: a dense medium to a less dense medium
options.D: a less dense to a dense medium

explanation:
Total internal reflection (TIR) is the optical phenomenon in which waves arrive at the interface (boundary) from one medium to another (e.g., from water to air). that is from a more optically denser medium to a less optically denser medium.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: A quantity of water at 0°C is heated to about 30°C. At each degree rise in temperature, its density will
explanation:
Water has a density of about 0.9998 g/cm³ at 0°C. As water is heated from 0°C to 4°C, it actuallyincreasesin density until it reaches its maximum density at approximately 4°C.  Once the temperature exceeds 4°C, the density starts todecreaseas the water continues to heat up towards 30°C.
Therefore, The density will rise and fall.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
I. Coherence
II. Same frequency
III. Same wavelength
IV. Same Intensity

Which of the conditions above are necessary to produce interference fringes?
explanation:
The necessary conditions to produce interference fringes areI (Coherence),II (Same Frequency), andIII (Same Wavelength). ConditionIV (Same Intensity)isnot necessary.

text: A thin wire with heavy weights attached to both ends is hung over a block of ice resting on two supports. If the wire cuts through the ice block while the block remains solid behind the wire, the process is called
explanation:
Regelation occurs when ice is subjected to pressure, causing it to melt at the point of contact. When the pressure is removed, the melted water can refreeze. This phenomenon is commonly observed in scenarios where ice is under stress, such as when a wire is pulled through it with weights attached.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

The reading above are for three consecutive days from a wet and dry bulb hygrometer. It can be concluded that the relative humidity for the three days
explanation:
123Dry30°C29°C25°CWet22°C22°C21°CDiff8°C7°C4°C

text: One end of a long wire is fixed while a vibrator is attached to the other end. When the vibrator is energized, the types of waves generated in the wire are
explanation:
The vibrator is fixed at the end of the rope, hence, it is stationary. Also, the vibrator causes the end of the wire to move up and down (or side to side), creating disturbances that travel along the length of the wire. The displacement of the particles in the wire is perpendicular to the direction of wave propagation, which is characteristic of transverse waves
Therefore, Option B is correct.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

explanation:

text: The main reason for making the cover of a vacuum flask airtight is to prevent heat loss by
explanation:
The airtight stopper prevents heat loss by convection because it is tightly sealed.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: A radio is operated by eight cells each of e.m.f. 2.0V connected in series. If two of the cells are wrongly connected, the net e.m.f. of the radio is
explanation:
When cells are connected in series, their voltages add up. However, if two cells are connected in the wrong direction, they will subtract from the total e.m.f
If all cells were connected correctly, the total e.m.f. would be: Total E.M.F = 8 x 2.0V = 16V ( since no of cell = 8. and E.M.F of each cells = 2.0V)
When two cells are connected in the reverse direction, their contributions effectively subtract from the total e.m.f
Contribution from 2 wrongly connected cell = 2 x 2.0v = 4V
Therefore, Total E.M.F = 16 - 4 = 12V.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: If a charged ion goes through combined electric and magnetic fields, the resultant emergent velocity of the ion is
explanation:
The resultant emergent velocity of a charged ion moving through combined electric and magnetic fields can be derived from the condition where the electric force equals the magnetic force. This gives us the formula for the velocity v:
q E = qvB
v = \(\frac{E}{B}\) (q will cancel out)
NOTE:  When both fields are present, for the ion to move without deflection, the electric force must equal the magnetic force.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

explanation:
V = 72mU = ?, Magnification = 24But Magnification = V/U∴ 24 = 72/UU = 72/24U = 3.0m

text: A cell of internal resistance 0.01Ω can be measured accurately using the
explanation:
A cell with internal resistance can be measured accurately using apotentiometer.
A potentiometer is an instrument used to measure the potential difference (voltage) across a component without drawing any current. This is crucial because drawing current can affect the measurement due to the internal resistance of the cell.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: What optical instrument can best be constructed with converging lenses of focal lengths 50cm and 5cm?
explanation:
An astronomical telescope traditionally consists of two converging lenses with the objective having a longer focal length than the eyepiece. In this case, the 50 cm lens would serve as the objective, and the 5 cm lens as the eyepiece, which is a standard configuration for astronomical telescopes.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: In a pure semiconductor, the number of electrons in the conduction band is

options.A: less than the number of holes in the valence band
options.B: equal to the number of holes in the valence band
options.C: greater than the number of holes in the valence band
options.D: twice the number of holes in the valence band

explanation:
In a pure (intrinsic) semiconductor, the number of electrons in the conduction band is equal to the number of holes in the valence band. This is because when an electron moves from the valence band to the conduction band, it leaves behind a hole.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
In a thermonuclear reaction, the total initial mass is 5.02 x \(10^{-{2}{7}}\)kg and the total final mass is 5.01 x \(10^{-{2}{7}}\)kg. The energy released in the process is
[c = 3.0 x \(10^8\) ms-1]
explanation:
In thermonuclear reactions,Energy = ∆mC\(^2\)∆m = Change in MassC = Speed of light∴ 5.02 x 10\(^{-27}\) - 5.01 x 10\(^{-27}\) x [3 x 10\(^8\)]\(^2\)0.01 x 10\(^{-27}\) x 9 x 10\(^{16}\)E = 9.0 x 10\(^{-13}\)J

text:
If the frequency of an emitted x-ray is 1.6 x 10\(^{16}\)Hz, the accelerating potential is?
[e = 1.6 x 10\(^{19}\)C, h = 6.63 x 10\(^{-34}\)Js]
explanation:
Energy imparted by the accelerating system = e x V, where V is the accelerating potential; and this energy is equal to the energy of the X-ray, give by hfe x V = hf∴ V = hf/e(6.63 x 10\(^{-34}\) x 1.6 x 10\(^{16}\))/1.6 x 10\(^{-19}\)= 6.63 x 10 = 66.3V

text: A certain radioactive source emits radiations that were found to be deflected by both magnetic and electric fields. The radiations are
explanation:
When a radioactive source emits radiations that are deflected by both magnetic and electric fields, the radiations are likely to bebeta particles(β particles).
Beta particles(β):These are high-energy, high-speed electrons (β-) or positrons (β+). They are negatively or positively charged, respectively, and are deflected by both electric and magnetic fields due to their charge and lower mass compared to alpha particles.
Gamma rays (γ): These are high-energy electromagnetic radiation and are neutral, meaning they are not deflected by electric or magnetic fields.
Alpha particles (α): These are positively charged and consist of two protons and two neutrons. They are not significantly deflected by electric or magnetic fields due to their relatively large mass and low speed.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

explanation:

text: A transverse wave is applied to a string whose mass per unit length is 3 x 10-2kgm-1. If the string is under a tension 12N, the speed of the propagation of the wave is
explanation:
For transverse wave on stringvelocity V = \(\sqrt{\frac{T}{M}}\)where T is the tension, and M is the mass per unit length∴ for T = 12N and M = 3.0 x 10\(^{-2}\)kgm\(^{-1}\)V =  \(\sqrt{\frac{12}{3.0 \times10^{-2}}}\)V  =  \(\sqrt{\frac{1200}{3}}\) =  \(\sqrt{400}\)∴ V = 20m/s

The Six's maximum and minimum thermometer uses a liquid-filled bulb connected to a U-shaped tube with a mercury thread. As the liquid expands or contracts, the mercury moves, pushing the steel indexes to indicate the maximum and minimum temperatures, which can be reset using a magnet.

text: The diagram above shows two capacitors P and Q of capacitance 5μF and 10μF. Find the charges stored in P and Q respectively
explanation:

text: In the diagram above a beam of white light travels from a rare to a dense medium. What colours of light do the rays a, b and c respectively represents?
explanation:
As the light enters the dense medium, the shorter wavelengths (blue and violet) bend more than the longer wavelengths (red and orange), resulting in the separation of the light into its component colors.
Based on this, the correct representation is:
> Ray a represents the red color
> Ray b represents the green color
> Ray c represents the blue color

explanation:

text: The correct position for a fuse in the diagram above is
explanation:
In the provided circuit diagram, the correct position for a fuse is between the "Line" connection and the component labeled "P".
The purpose of a fuse is to protect the circuit and the connected device from excessive current flow that could potentially cause damage. By placing the fuse at position P, it will be in series with the "live" or "hot" wire, allowing it to interrupt the circuit if the current exceeds the fuse's rated capacity.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: If current flows in the direction of the arrows in the solenoid above, the north pole is at
explanation:
In a solenoid, the north pole is determined using the right-hand grip rule: if the current flows in the direction of the arrows, the north pole is at the end where the thumb points when the fingers follow the current. Therefore, the north pole is at the end labeled Q.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.
